title: Avantika jaiswal
author: Avantika jaiswal
content: I usually Invest a very small amount of bitcoin to another coin because I know this time is very crucial to invest in any new coin or even in an old coin.Any suggestion from your side which is good for long term

comments.author: reagansimms
comments.body: The more flour you have, the more cake options you can make. The money you get from selling 1 BTC is very much, you can buy whatever coin you like based on personal research calculations. Investment advice has been widely shared in forums and you can find it on google based on the keywords you enter. My best advice is to save your 1 BTC until you can hold it, it's better than putting some money on a new coin that hasn't been fully tested in the market.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: First your subject topic doesn’t correlate with the main message body. First I would say there are different exchanges that actually offer pairs of btc to different coins and tokens. So if you wish to swap to those coins you can use these exchanges and then move your coins into your wallet. Concerning investing into Alticoins for the purpose of diversification of portfolio, I would say it is definitely not advisable to me especially at this moment where the market trend is fluctuating. Investing into Alticoins poses more risk because it is not certain that most of them will survive this market. Moreover why i don’t advice investing too much on Alticoins are because they just follow the trend of bitcoin movement with just few coins moving slightly higher interms of gain percentage but also when it comes to dumping they fall way below and some crashes totally. So if it is about security and probably profit then stick to bitcoin. This is also not to discourage you from Alticoins but be rest assured that most of them are just pump and dump coins and investing in them is just pure gamble

This makes bitcoin the most preferred cryptocurrency except if you think you've got that boldness for investing on any alts being an experience user.

comments.author: elevates
comments.body: You need to make your own choices rather asking for an advice on a public forum. People asking for investment advice without doing proper research tend to get confuse. When you are confused you lose your ability to decide what is good for you.My advice to you is to keep holding your 1 BTC till the next bull run. Decide at what point you want to gain profit and then go ahead and sell some of it. The fiat amount you got keep some of it to buy more when the bear market comes. Keep on doing it and you will end up with more BTC. Alway do your own research before investing as it is your BTC and not ours.

comments.body: At the present time, investing in bitcoin is the best option. There is not enough liquidity in the markets to make speculations in any new currencies, so you rarely find a digital currency that rises with excellent trading volumes in the short or medium term at the present time.But if I were you, I would invest in:Ethereum.Dogecoin.AI-related coins with real use, especially those that have links to projects in the medical fields.Any investment that you think will achieve a return of about 10% during the next 3 months and can be quickly liquidated.
